content.key_points:
- NST assesses fetal activity and wellbeing.
- Inform the client that the test is painless.
- It will take 20-30 minutes.
- A fetal monitor will be used.
- Two belts with two sensors will be worn around the belly. One sensor will monitor the contractions. One sensor will track the babyâ€™s heart rate.
- The client is instructed to press a button on the device every time they feel the baby move.
- Reactive test- acceleration of fetal heart rate of more than 15 beats per minute above baseline FHR, lasting for 15 seconds or more.
- Non-reactive test- acceleration of FHR of less than 15 beats per minute above baseline FHR may indicate fetal jeopardy.

questions.question_text: Which of the following findings indicate a reactive non-stress test?
options: 1. FHR remaining unchanged with maternal movement
questions.rationale:
**RATIONALE**

FHR that increases with fetal movement reflect a reactive non- stress test, indicative of intact central and autonomic nervous system, a sign of fetal wellbeing.

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete concept content on a single book page.
extraction_metadata.reference: Pillitteri, Adele. Maternal and Child Health Nursing, Philadelphia. Lippincott Williams and Wilkins
